Posts.Content: hi liddyloo, they kept saying same to me about using aqueous but my opinion if people recommend other creams which they have found useful and hasn't don't them any harm its worth trying and as far as I am concerned the aveeno did improve mine a lot quicker
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: hi lilanc, I have just finished radiotherapy and was told just to use e45 or aqueous cream which I couldn't use so I started using double base cream but after reading on here someone mentioned that they had probs with soreness etc and said that aveeno cream worked for them I did mention it to the radiotherapist but she said not to use it but I did and have to say it improved my soreness dramatically Not saying it works for everyone but worth trying if nothing else works
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: finished radiotherapy in January and now on letrozole for 10 years . Was wondering if its normal to still have tightening and tenderness in breast area or should I get it checked
Posts.Title: question

Posts.Content: No I had a lumpectomy , then further op to get clear margins . Get so paranoid every little thing. Don't know what's normal and what isn't. Nobody really said
Posts.Title: question

Posts.Content: thanks monika for your comments but I spoke to radiologist yesterday and said was a bit unusual as only my second week Got the doc to check me out who requested an xray Still not got results back so am hoping all is ok My blood pressure was also sky high so seeing doc this afternoon to review my blood pressure tabs Never plain sailing is it lol
Posts.Title: radiotherapy- breathlessness

Posts.Content: I have just finished second week of radiotherapy and feel really breathless Even just walking to the car . Spoke to oncologist and she said was normal cos you get tired Wondering if anyone else had this prob and if so what did your oncologist say
Posts.Title: radiotherapy- breathlessness

Posts.Content: thanks Lynnyk Glad you are back to normal I have another week yet as got to have a booster week Good luck lets hope this year is a better one for us all x
Posts.Title: radiotherapy- breathlessness

Posts.Content: hi all Had my second op on my breast 11 days ago due to the fact they said there were some pre cancerous cells in the first lot of results . My second lot of results came back all clear I have no lymph nodes affected and  my cancer is grade 3, but initially was told grade 2 on the biopsy. I initially was told I would probably have radiotherapy and tabs for about 5 years but the fact it is now grade 3 there is a chance of chemo also Am still waiting to see oncologist so still uncertain of my treatment (the dreaded waiting game again). The consultant said if I needed chemo would have that first. My question is if I need chemo why would I need radiotherapy also, as I thought that radiotherapy just focused on the area of the cancer . Am confused as the results came back clear
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: thanks for the info Go to oncologist on tues so will know more then Might sound silly but when you have chemo how long does it last each session and is it just given in a day then a break or what? Have no idea what to expect
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: thanks chaz Have you finished your treatment now and how did you find it all Any tips greatfully received
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: thanks weemaw. How did you find all the treatment Am very nervous about it all I know it is not going to be a walk in the park but I dolike to know the worse case scenario so anything else is a bonus . Will keep you updated x
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: hi nettie thanks for your input How do you know if you are having chemo and rads if you havnt seen your oncologist yet I am still in limbo as to what I am having but will find out tomorrow Not looking forward to it but will just go with whatever is needed Like you if I have to have chemo have decided I will hae my hair cut short. Where did you get your head scarves from ?. Be nice to hear how you get on also x
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: thanks weemaw. Bet its nice seeing light at the end of the tunnel. Update on oncologist I got my dates mixed up . After I got my results from consultant was told I would see the oncologist within 2 weeks so as I got the letter at the end of the first week , I presumed that when it said tues it was the following week Silly me didnt look at the date . I was so annoyed tho having gone to what I thought was finally my appt that I had to wait another 2 weeks . Am still in limbo yet again Went to see one of the breast care nurses who said that treatment usually starts about 6-8 weeks after surgery I explained to her that I was unable to plan anything cos I still dont know if am having chemo . She then said that it would be discussed at the meeting with oncologist. Why do we have to be kept in the dark so long Probably to them it doesnt seem that long but seems a never ending wait for us . At least I have an idea now what to expect . Sorry for rant Just rather be getting it over with and on the road to recovery. Glad you are getting there
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: hi babs I have recently been diagnosed with breast cancer I live in Darwen. I have just had my first lot of surgery but need to go back a week today to have some more removed as there are pre cancerous cells there. Then they will let me know what course of treatment to have My sis has been very supportive but always nice to chat to someone that is going through it We went to a support group yesterday at Beardwood hospital in Blackburn which runs the first tues of every month at 7.30pm .If you need a chat don't hesitate to contact me . Am sure you know more than me but always good to talk :-)
Posts.Title: Could I suggest buddy system? You could have a bosom buddy too :-...

Posts.Content: have started letrozole and been given adcal also for my bones The oncologist said I could take evening primrose as well but when I spoke to bcn nurse the other day she said they don't really recommend it Was wondering if anyone else takes any herbal treatment  for their joints in conjuction with the adcal or has anyone else been told not to use evening primrose
Posts.Title: herbal remedies

Posts.Content: still need help
Posts.Title: herbal remedies

Posts.Content: hi Valerie-anne I am on letrozole also same dosage I have put all my weight back on that Iost at slimming world (over a stone) Not a happy bunny Am seeing the nurse on 9th feb so gonna mention it. If you like walking just going out every day for a brisk walk should help and if you love swimming go for it Don't worry about anyone else
Posts.Title: weight gain on hormone therapy

Posts.Content: just wondering if it would be the same for me I am on letrozole but no-one has said to me about wearing stockings whilst flying

Posts.Content: just reading this post and have to say wasn't aware you had to wear stockings Is this for everyone who has had breast cancer ??

Posts.Content: just wondering if it would be the same for me I am on letrozole but no-one has said to me about wearing stockings whilst flying

Posts.Content: just reading this post and have to say wasn't aware you had to wear stockings Is this for everyone who has had breast cancer ??
Posts.Title: Flight stockings

Posts.Content: Hi thanks to all your replies Made things a lot clearer Still not sure if I am having chemo yet as they havnt discussed my treatment fully until I have my further op thurs to remove some more tissue as there are pre cancerous cells but highly possible will need chemo. Think the picc line will be better for me as they have trouble finding my veins anyhow when I have blood taken Dont like parting with it lol
Posts.Title: picc lines

Posts.Content: can anyone give me any info on picc lines and any probs that may occur Is it painful to insert ?
Posts.Title: picc lines

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie Ask gp if he can you refer you to the local gym or leisure centre . I was referred by my gp to local leisure centre where they do a healthwise scheme I get 12 weeks free.
Posts.Title: exercise on prescription
